description.text: Another way to get water is to drop some saplings or leaves into the Centrifugal Separator. It will give you a bit of water, about 1/10th of a bucket. Remember, you can power your machines with the flux capacitor from your emergency supply chest. MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT USE UP ALL OF YOUR SAPLINGS.

longDescription.text: This was previously a QDS task to submit liquid purified water. However, technical issues prevent QDS liquid submission for now.

description.text: The night is dark and full of terrors. Your chances of survival are low, but you can improve them with some sort of weapon and some protection from attack.
Weapons

longDescription.text: For your weapon, you'll need the blade to be bone to start. No other starting material is comparable for weapons.

description.text: Armor

longDescription.text: Wooden armor is a good early way to defend yourself. Be careful though, all that coverage can heat you up.

description.text:
In case case of crash landing, you were equipped with a basic survival package:
- Saplings
- Fertilizer
- Dried nutrient blocks
Note: Choose this path if you want a challenge. Don't expect to live. Completing this quest disables the easy route quest.
Grab some dust!

With a furnace up, you can now take your next step. Look by the port engine, the one not currently on fire. Apparently the water reclamation leaked a little and has turned some of the dust to clay. Dig it up and make a crucible. Stick a torch under that and not only can you melt cobble to lava but you can smelt ore dust to ingots, if you provide it with a faucet and a casting table or basin. If you ever need more clay, it can be made from water and dust in a barrel.
Warming up

longDescription.text: You can use the crucible as a mini-smeltery. Shift-right click to place a faucet. It only takes blocks, not dusts or broken pieces of ore. If you've still have lava by the broken engine, you can use that to heat your crucible. Also, you can make casts by pouring gold over stone parts.

description.text: Now that you are stable and able to live somewhat comfortably, it's time to look beyond immediate survival and start planning for your future. For true industrialization, you will need plastic. You may need to visit the cities.
Next tasks
To build up from nothing, you'll have to have some interesting survival strategies, and unique tools to go with them.

longDescription.text: A crook can give you silkworms from breaking leaves and a hammer can crush stone into gravel and sand.

description.text: If you need to glue something in a pinch, you don't need to find slime to do it. It turns out some water and flour makes for a great adhesive.

longDescription.text: Craft some water and flour together to make paste, a sticky substance that can be used in many recipes instead of slimeballs.

description.text: Congrats on slaying those monsters
Dirty Deeds
Done Dirt Cheap

In case case of crash landing, you were equipped with a deluxe survival package:
- Supplies for a sync shell
- 32 Extra shotgun shells
- Saplings
- Fertilizer
- Choice of sandwich
Note: Choose this for an easier experience. Completing this quest disables the hard route quest.
Grab some dust!
Is it just me or does this planet have a lot of undead hostiles. The lack of any life forms baffle me as to how endless they feel.
Holding out for a hero...

longDescription.text: Because of some hqm limitations, you will have to get the mob drops!

description.text: ...till the end of the night

If you haven't noticed, water is hard to find on this dry planet. If you get desperate enough, you can mix a glass bottle with a dirt block to get some dirty water. Make sure not to use up all your dirt though, you'll need it for growing trees and crops.
Dirty dirt
Sometimes, paste just won't do. Maybe you're just sick of the smell, or maybe you need the special properties of earth, sky, ichor, and ender slime balls for advanced tinkering.

longDescription.text: The best way to get special types of slimes is through sifting. Earthslime can be crafted in a few ways, but to get the others, you'll need to sift with their respective materials. Earthslime and skyslime can be found sifting podzol, ichor can be found sifting crushed netherrack, and enderslime can be found sifting crushed end stone.

description.text: For your continued survival, you'll need to start farming crops and trees on a larger scale. Neither of those are able to take root in the dust of this planet. However, you can compost organic material in a barrel to make some more dirt for yourself.

longDescription.text: Make a barrel with some planks and a slab, then drop some leaves or saplings into it to start composting it into dirt. You'll be farming in no time.

description.text: This world doesn't have any lava lakes or dragons, so you'll have to get some materials in other ways. A barrel full of lava can be turned into netherrack or endstone using redstone or glowstone respectively.

longDescription.text: You'll need a stone barrel, or you risk spreading lava everywhere.

description.text: You'll need more power eventually, but making any kind of advanced machinery is difficult and often requires circuit boards. However, you can set up a basic source of power with the same fuel as a furnace.

longDescription.text: A pitiful generator can be powered with furnace fuel, charcoal or coal blocks are a very effective power source. It's slow, and you should upgrade to something better as soon as possible, but it will do for now.

description.text: The harsh reality is that you're stuck on this planet. No amount of obsidian rectangles will let you escape. However, the situation means you can't get some resources (like soul sand) through normal methods.
Spores

longDescription.text: To start, you'll have to sift some dirt, probably a lot of it. Eventually you'll find some mycelium spores. Plant the spores on a piece of dirt and you'll get mycelium.

description.text: Witch Water Infusion

longDescription.text: Placing some mycelium under a barrel full of water will slowly convert it into Witch Water. Put some sand in a barrel of Witch Water and it will turn into soul sand.

description.text: Dirty water may help you in a pinch, but for long term survival, you'll need to purify it. Fire should work nicely. Just drop the dirty water bottle into a furnace, apply some heat, and you'll get some clean, drinkable water. Alternatively, you can use charcoal filters when you have the resources.

String mesh can be upgraded to flint mesh to gain higher yields. It can be further upgraded later when you get the resources. You can get flint from sifting gravel, which can be crushed from cobblestone.

Your new crucible can turn leaves into small amounts of water. It works like your Centrifugal Separator, but you only need a torch to power it. It's slow, but it makes investing in some shears early a good idea.
Singular bucket o water
Trading in ten bottles of purified water should allow me to create you something strong.

longDescription.text: Snowmen don't last long in a desert. You may want to take some precautions or be ready with a shovel.

description.text: A finely crafted weapon or tool isn't as easy as strapping some rocks to a stick. In fact, basic tools like that won't work for you at all. You'll have to tinker around a bit.
Worktables

longDescription.text: First, make a part builder and a tinker station. The part builder lets you make parts by combining a pattern and a material. The tinker station lets you assemble parts into tools.

description.text: Handles

longDescription.text: Every tool needs a handle, a wood handle should do the trick. You can make one by putting some wood in the part builder with a pattern.

description.text:
Emergency Survival Checklist:

1. Perform self-diagnostics and administer emergency first aid to treat any injuries.
2. Assess the environment for potential threats, resources, and shelter. Exercise caution around the detached reactor, containment has breached and high-temperature fuel is leaking.
3. Ration available food and water. The water reclamation system is damaged and leaking, you will have to find an alternate source of drinking water.
4. Recover supplies from the ship's emergency survival equipment storage, located in the black box above ship's power. Available supplies include:
  a. Multipurpose wrench
  b. Basic particulate sieve
  c. Emergency firearm
  d. Emergency battery pack
  e. Portable assembly unit
  f. MAT input interface
5. Refer back to the MAT unit when complete. The replicator should be able to provide some bottles and some water. It has taken damage but appears to just barely be functional.
6. Proceed to the next available survival task. Consult your MAT unit regularly for recommended tasks and adaptive advice for your continued survival.

longDescription.text: If you are having issues surviving your first night, it may help you to make a trench around the ship. Use that dust from digging that to build a 2 block wall on the inside of the trench. That should keep you safe from everything but spiders. To deal with them, make a small overhang out of stone or wood when you can afford it.

description.text:
Despite the planet's high temperature, it isn't nearly hot enough cook food or melt metals. For that, you will need a furnace. Sieve dust and dirt for stone, use the stones to make cobblestone, use the cobblestone to make a furnace.
If you want to sift faster, you can place sieves next to one another, allowing up to 25 sieves to be used at once. Alternatively, a compressed sieve takes up just one block and can sift compressed dust with a slight reduction in output.
What this planet lacks in water, it makes up for in metals. If you spend some time sifting the dust, you can make serious progress towards some infrastructure.
The fertilizer in your survival package will not last long. Place the mesh in the sieve and sift some dust to get bonemeal.
Sifting for Bonemeal

longDescription.text: Make sure you plant something in the dirt right away!

description.text: For further industrialization, you'll need to move items, fluids, and energy around. Time to set up the plumbing.

longDescription.text: Conduits are made from conduit binder and their respective materials. You can change conduit settings by right clicking their I/O interface or right clicking with a wrench to make quick adjustments.

description.text: You'll need some tools to stay alive out here as well. In Tinkers Construct, bone tools are usually the best at the start, but you could make a different type if you'd like. Wood and stone tools are generally ineffective.
Tools

longDescription.text: You can make a mattock with the axe and adze heads, it will be an essential tool for farming early on. Eventually you may want a pickaxe and some other tools, but farming food is vital for your survival, and the mattock can help mine logs and dust as well.

description.text: Its highly recommended to craft string armor once you get enough string.
